English.Char_Desc_2000:
Generate a report of disk usage that can be used to determine the directories consuming most disk space.
Features: - Supports long paths and special characters in path names. - Reports last modification timestamp in a smart way (gets rid of wrong dates). - Skips junctions as they do not consume space, optionally also includes them - Directories sorted alphabetically in the report for easier comparison - One exe only, no need to install, unpack and use - No GUI, no pop-ups (can be used by services, CruiseControl, ...) - Allows specification of the locale to be used ('.'/',' issue for decimal values) - Optional generation of a XML report - Optional report all empty files (zero bytes sized) - Provide a list of junctions
Running it is a childplay: SizeReporter.exe [options] "pathtree to analyse" "depth of reporting".
During the run, it displays information on the console while generating the report and error log file on disk.
The tool can be used in scheduled tasks or by scripts on a weekly base for example. The report contains the directories sorted alphabetically thus produces results that can be compared from run to run.
